newsitem.title: PERU: South Africa's Unique seeks niche in Peru.
newsitem.headline: South Africa's Unique seeks niche in Peru.

text.p: South Africa's Unique Engineering company hopes to find a niche in Peru to sell its hydraulic props for underground mining, the company's managing director said.
Roy Van Rensburg told Reuters that Peru's Compania Minera Poderosa S.A. had already bought a trial batch of 50 props, while another local firm, Compania Minera Retamas, was also showing interest.

"People here are hungry for new ideas and new technology. I am convinced that in the future, once this equipment becomes known, there will be a growing interest in Peru's mining sector," he told Reuters during a week-long visit to Peru.
Unique is one of three South African-based hydraulic prop manufacturers, and sells in its home country and in Zimbabwe.
Van Rensburg said the company was focusing on Peru due to the enormous potential for growth in the mining sector and the absence of hydraulic props in the local industry.
The current use of timber props in narrow reef mines had both safety and environmental disadvantages, he said.
"Once Poderosa has satisfied itself that there are advantages to use the system, I think it will spread quickly," he said. "There is great potential here."
